items.sentence: I always felt ill at ease in my father's company.
I usually buy my clothes at the department store.
I make it a rule to get up at six in the morning.
I like to take a hot bath every night before bed.
I must get up as early as I can tomorrow morning.
I make a point of being in time for appointments.
I was caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.
Tom is looking for someone, but I don't know who.
Tom tried to leave the restaurant without paying.
I lived in Boston until I was thirteen years old.
Tom didn't go because Mary didn't want him to go.
I thought you said that this was going to be fun.
You\'ll get into trouble if your parents find out.
You\'ll have to do it, whether you like it or not.
You\'re going to have to talk about what happened.
You\'re going to stay with us a long time, I hope.
I have a pretty good idea what\'s going to happen.
I haven\'t eaten anything for the past three days.
I haven\'t eaten anything since yesterday morning.
Tom raised an interesting question at our meeting.
